children.name: according
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: after
children.sourceText: And after this manner did they teach them.

children.name: all
children.sourceText: And there are many among us who have many revelations, for they are not all stiffnecked.

children.name: among
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: and
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: as
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: because
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: but
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that by so doing they kept them from being destroyed upon the face of the land; for they did prick their hearts with the word, continually stirring them up unto repentance.

children.name: can
children.sourceText: But behold, my brethren, ye can go to the other plates of Nephi; for behold, upon them the records of our wars are engraven, according to the writings of the kings, or those which they caused to be written.

children.name: could
children.sourceText: For what could I write more than my fathers have written?

children.name: few
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: from
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: he
children.sourceText: But the word of the Lord was verified, which he spake unto our fathers, saying that:

children.name: him
children.sourceText: Wherefore, the prophets, and the priests, and the teachers, did labor diligently, exhorting with all long-suffering the people to diligence; teaching the law of Moses, and the intent for which it was given; persuading them to look forward unto the Messiah, and believe in him to come as though he already was.

children.name: I
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: if
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that the prophets of the Lord did threaten the people of Nephi, according to the word of God, that if they did not keep the commandments, but should fall into transgression, they should be destroyed from off the face of the land.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: And now, behold, two hundred years had passed away, and the people of Nephi had waxed strong in the land.

children.name: into
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that the prophets of the Lord did threaten the people of Nephi, according to the word of God, that if they did not keep the commandments, but should fall into transgression, they should be destroyed from off the face of the land.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: many
children.sourceText: And there are many among us who have many revelations, for they are not all stiffnecked.

children.name: may
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: me
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Yea; and this sufficeth me.

children.name: must
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: my
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: neither
children.sourceText: And they profaned not; neither did they blaspheme.

children.name: nevertheless
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: nor
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: of
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: off
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: or
children.sourceText: But our kings and our leaders were mighty men in the faith of the Lord; and they taught the people the ways of the Lord; wherefore, we withstood the Lamanites and swept them away out of our lands, and began to fortify our cities, or whatsoever place of our inheritance.

children.name: other
children.sourceText: But behold, my brethren, ye can go to the other plates of Nephi; for behold, upon them the records of our wars are engraven, according to the writings of the kings, or those which they caused to be written.

children.name: our
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: out
children.sourceText: But our kings and our leaders were mighty men in the faith of the Lord; and they taught the people the ways of the Lord; wherefore, we withstood the Lamanites and swept them away out of our lands, and began to fortify our cities, or whatsoever place of our inheritance.

children.name: shall
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: should
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: so
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that by so doing they kept them from being destroyed upon the face of the land; for they did prick their hearts with the word, continually stirring them up unto repentance.

children.name: than
children.sourceText: For what could I write more than my fathers have written?

children.name: that
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: the
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: their
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: them
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: there
children.sourceText: And there are many among us who have many revelations, for they are not all stiffnecked.

children.name: these
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: they
children.sourceText: For have not they revealed the plan of salvation?

children.name: this
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Yea; and this sufficeth me.

children.name: those
children.sourceText: But behold, my brethren, ye can go to the other plates of Nephi; for behold, upon them the records of our wars are engraven, according to the writings of the kings, or those which they caused to be written.

children.name: though
children.sourceText: Wherefore, the prophets, and the priests, and the teachers, did labor diligently, exhorting with all long-suffering the people to diligence; teaching the law of Moses, and the intent for which it was given; persuading them to look forward unto the Messiah, and believe in him to come as though he already was.

children.name: thus
children.sourceText: And thus being prepared to meet the Lamanites, they did not prosper against us.

children.name: to
children.sourceText: Now behold, I, Jarom, write a few words according to the commandment of my father, Enos, that our genealogy may be kept.

children.name: unto
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Yea; and this sufficeth me.

children.name: up
children.sourceText: And it came to pass that by so doing they kept them from being destroyed upon the face of the land; for they did prick their hearts with the word, continually stirring them up unto repentance.

children.name: upon
children.sourceText: And they were scattered upon much of the face of the land, and the Lamanites also.

children.name: us
children.sourceText: And there are many among us who have many revelations, for they are not all stiffnecked.

children.name: we
children.sourceText: But our kings and our leaders were mighty men in the faith of the Lord; and they taught the people the ways of the Lord; wherefore, we withstood the Lamanites and swept them away out of our lands, and began to fortify our cities, or whatsoever place of our inheritance.

children.name: what
children.sourceText: For what could I write more than my fathers have written?

children.name: whatsoever
children.sourceText: But our kings and our leaders were mighty men in the faith of the Lord; and they taught the people the ways of the Lord; wherefore, we withstood the Lamanites and swept them away out of our lands, and began to fortify our cities, or whatsoever place of our inheritance.

children.name: wherefore
children.sourceText: And as these plates are small, and as these things are written for the intent of the benefit of our brethren the Lamanites, wherefore, it must needs be that I write a little; but I shall not write the things of my prophesying, nor of my revelations.

children.name: which
children.sourceText: And as many as are not stiffnecked and have faith, have communion with the Holy Spirit, which maketh manifest unto the children of men, according to their faith.

children.name: who
children.sourceText: And there are many among us who have many revelations, for they are not all stiffnecked.

children.name: with
children.sourceText: And as many as are not stiffnecked and have faith, have communion with the Holy Spirit, which maketh manifest unto the children of men, according to their faith.

children.name: would
children.sourceText: And they were exceedingly more numerous than were they of the Nephites; and they loved murder and would drink the blood of beasts.

children.name: ye
children.sourceText: But behold, my brethren, ye can go to the other plates of Nephi; for behold, upon them the records of our wars are engraven, according to the writings of the kings, or those which they caused to be written.

children.name: yea
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Yea; and this sufficeth me.

children.name: yet
children.sourceText: Behold, it is expedient that much should be done among this people, because of the hardness of their hearts, and the deafness of their ears, and the blindness of their minds, and the stiffness of their necks; nevertheless, God is exceedingly merciful unto them, and has not as yet swept them off from the face of the land.

children.name: you
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Yea; and this sufficeth me.
